website_summaries.verdict: With its optional center divider, you can configure this tent as one large room or two separate rooms, making it perfect for family camping.
pros: Fiberglass poles and steel uprights provide strength and stability
cons: Some buyers experienced durability issues, but they seem to be in the minority

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: So after doing too much tent research I choose this one. My only negative is the directions to put this tent together are pretty sad and trying to squeeze it back into the bag is very tight , But it was very simple to figure it out . The tent set up quickly and I was amazed on how roomy it was . We had high winds 30 mph gust and rain, the tent held up great and we stayed dry. The tent is high quality and I hope I can get many years out of it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This tent was a very good choice. I checked reviews and researched and hit the jackpot. I have used this tent 7 times now and I ca tell you that it is made very well. I have not had it in rain yet but I have had it in very strong winds and it help up like a charm. The tent has plenty of ventilation. My Husband is 6' 3" and has no problem standing and walking anywhere in this tent. It's easy to put up and fits into the storage bag much easier than other I have owned.It has a zip up room divider if you are sharing the tent or need privacy while changing your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Schubert

customer_reviews.title: This tent is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty tent. The floor is thicker than most tents but I will still put down a tarp under the tent. This won't be a great winter tent because the fly is build to let air escape. I still plan on using in the snow. I will use a larger tarp to cover and insult heat. The cross beam pole on the roof are thick and can handle wind and snow. The upright poles are metal and even thicker. This tent is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: All windows and corners leaked
customer_reviews.text: If there is any driving rain or any summer thunder storm you can forget about having a dry tent. All of our windows had a steady drip at the seams and all four corners a stream of water pouring in. Terrible tent for water resistance. Photos attached are after we soaked up puddles from corners. We had to keep our beach towels in the corners of the tent for the rest of our stay. This was not user error, the tent was set up as instructed, tethered, and the fly attached perfectly. We even had a tarp down underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Team Dream 17

customer_reviews.title: I Lo ved this tent, but after 2 years ...
customer_reviews.text: I Lo ved this tent, but after 2 years of use, the rain fly became brittle and cracked. Now I have holes in my rain fly. I'm trying to work with Browning to see if its covered under warranty. BEWARE: They say 10 year warranty, but the criteria for what is warranty and what is wear and tear is quite subjective.
customer_reviews.author: Dana A. Martinezmoles

customer_reviews.title: Damaged, unusable on site.
customer_reviews.text: We received the tent the day before a family camping trip. Packed it up without even checking the contents. We had read many reviews and watched YouTube videos on the tent. From what we understood it was manufactured by a very reputable company. Upon opening the tent we found that the shock cord for several of the poles was broken. Not just came untied, but actually frayed and broken. The tent was unusable for us. We ended up going to a local Walmart and buying a smaller tent to get us through the week. I wouldn't buy again and instead will be looking for a more reputable brand of product.
customer_reviews.author: dlevasseur

customer_reviews.title: Great tent easy set up durable and washable
customer_reviews.text: So my wife threw me out of the house...long story.... and I bought this to set up in the yard till she would take me back...I was chopping some fire wood and part of the log flew into one of the windows and it didn't even tear it or nothing . The other side of the log caught me in the face and cut me open pretty good....I got blood all over the floor where I passed out...but it hosed right off and after drying with my shirt...no stain...its getting cold now so hopefully it will be warm too...better than the refrigerator box that's for sure
customer_reviews.author: the sult

customer_reviews.title: We love the tent.
customer_reviews.text: A pole broke second time out, waiting to see what amazon is going to do about it. Other then that it was great. Never mind the pole is bring replaced by browning. Amazon is sending us a replacement tent, which we will now return. We love the Tent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Only Dry Tent in Camp!
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a week of camping where it rained every day including some flash floods and pretty violent storms. My Coleman EZup shade structure came home in pieces but the Browning / Alps tent was flawless. Most tents at camp had inches of water. I did have some very small puddles until I realized I needed to stake out the rain fly. After that it was bone dry. I had a tarp underneath which captured tons of water between the tarp and the tent bottom, but amazingly no water leaked thru the bottom of the tent. I will continue to buy Alps / Browning products.
customer_reviews.author: LY

customer_reviews.title: A few things...
customer_reviews.text: The only bad things about the tent is that the top screen allows access to tiny insects and flies. Also, there is always air flow in the tent so on cold nights pack some extra blankets. Also, the windows on the doors does not stay still when opened, folded and tucked in. The other Windows are fine. The pockets have limited use because you can't use them all but only half the top one when the separator cloth is opened. Other than that its a good tent and I do enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Moses

customer_reviews.title: This is a great BIG tent for a family
customer_reviews.text: This is a great BIG tent for a family. Easy to put up. Cons: the back door concerns me; as generally the kids are in the back. Could someone get in? I've decided that I'll put a zip tie on the back zipper so it can't be opened to relieve my fear. The 2nd is the floor; it is not a rough and tough floor; it's simply nylon. I will consider buying a tarp to place in the inside as to keep the floor from wearing out too quickly. I'll let you know more when a good rain comes down to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: impressed
customer_reviews.text: Went camping this past weekend up to New Hampshire, and tent setup was done under the rain. The tent held up very well in the rain and wind, and loved how spacious it was. We were able to fit 2 queens size mattresses on one side and another queen size mattress on the other room, we didn't close the room divider in order to walk around and maneuver inside. a total of 7 people and 1 dog slept inside the tent. Looking forward to camping over labor day weekend.
customer_reviews.author: QueensFinest

customer_reviews.title: Good budget 8 people tent.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality spacious 8 people tent. However, the instructions assembling it is not that clear. Had a hard time understanding how to make it stay up. I then figured out the pins needed to go on each end of the hollow black poles. So frustrating that was not mentioned in the instruction. Easy to put together though when you put it together once. I just wish the wall pockets were place by the doors and wish there were hooks to hang the small lanterns. Haven't tested the tent yet if it's water resistant because it didn't rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Priced Right
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. Super spacious. The price is fantastic. Shipping was great too. It is also a very attractive tent. Pros: Super spacious. Priced competitively. Shipping included. Very attractive. Good value. Cons: The wind is this tents enemy. It is also not terribly water resistant. I put two cans of stuff on the fly to the tune of twenty bucks and I still got a few raindrops in my ear. Now, given we live in Alaska and it's a lot more windy and rainy here than most places this tent is going to be used, but there it is. Summary: This tent is a good fair weather tent at a very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but pole quality not so great
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this tent from all the great reviews. It's really big, very spacious with plenty of windows and two entrances. Setup was really easy and it goes up quick, and the fly is a cinch. It rained the second day we had it up and there wasn't so much as a drop inside the tent, I was quite impressed. Unfortunately on that same day one of the fly poles snapped, for a tent like this I expected more. Rather disappointing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brown

customer_reviews.title: excellent tent. i can set it up by myself
customer_reviews.text: excellent tent. i can set it up by myself. it's large enough for our queen sized air mattress on one side and our stuff and 2 kids cots on the other side. and still give space to move around. My only complaint is that the doors are on two different sides. in most campgrounds that puts on door to the back of the camp site, giving the opportunity for someone to sneak into the tent unseen.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome family tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent rocks! It is super easy to set up and is very strong. It does help to have two people, but isn’t totally necessary. I’m 5’11” and am able to walk around everywhere inside without ducking. You might want to purchase some better stakes eventually, these work but aren’t pointed. There’s no ground cloth, so purchase a 10’ x 15’ tarp to use. The tent is really heavy, but it’s gigantic. You can fit 3 queen blow up mattresses in it and still have room to walk!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Solid value and reliable zippers!
customer_reviews.text: I have camped twice in this tent and I am very reassured that I’ve finally found a sturdy and reliable tent. Quite easy to set up with two people. I put a tarp underneath as the ground was damp and after a rain water git betwee the ground tarpand the tent but no moisture came up through the floor. Amazing. Also I usually don’t even bother with rainflies on tents,optimg for ky own tarp instead, but this one works so well all I did was spray waterproofing on the lower outside area and no mousture came through the sides either. Love thus tent!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Early

customer_reviews.title: The best tent I've had so far.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tent to comfortably spend my vacations with the family. While I had seen reviews from previous buyers (some very good ones) I did not know if it would really meet my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised to start unfolding it on the ground and see that it really was great. More than what I expected. The clothing is really good. Good seams The well-designed doors and the best of all is the height. I am 1.85 m tall and I hate to touch the roof canvas with my head. Not close. really wide. I add to this all the mosquito nets that allow a spectacular ventilation. The best tent I've had so far.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Carámbula

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Love it Easy to put up easy to fold up and put back. It stormed the second night and no leaks at all. The first night had the fly off and there was a million Michigan stars out.It was awesome. The screen roof and all the windows keep it cool when needed close everything up and you stay dry and warm on cooler or wet nights. The size is enormous. I might bring my sofa and 70 inch flat screen next time. LOL!!! Its a great tent and I am glad I bought it after looking at so many others I'm sure I made a good discussion. I'm a happy camper now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for family Glamping!
customer_reviews.text: To Crater Lake NP and beyond! Purchased this tent to take our family vacation in. It worked perfectly. My wife an I set it up in the dark for the very first time in about a half hour. Our second attempt at erection went much smoother and we were done rainfly and all in 15. This tent definitely takes 2 people to assemble. Zippers are stout, walls are almost vertical, and it has ample room for 4 cots plus our plethora of gear. 5 stars! Note: Tent does not have ANY anchor points for the recommended floor saver. Very disappointed in that.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tent
customer_reviews.text: This a very nice, big tent. It was easy to put up and seemed to be of very good quality. We took it, untested, on a camping trip and it went up in very little time. There was plenty of room for kids and their gear. We woke up the next morning to the sound of unexpected rain. The inside of the tent stayed completely dry as it rained for over two hours. It was just as easy to take down and even the storage bags seem to be high-quality. Overall this is a very nice tent and will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: thepingun

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this tent 5 stars. We’ve had this tent over 1.5 years with only 3 uses. It leaked pretty good the second time we used it. The last time we used it, the awning rod snapped in half. The zipper also has a tendency to get stuck & caught quite often, this has always been an issue. It is quite spacious inside & that we like. I was hoping for something as advertised rather than another leaking tent. This tent wasn’t cheap.
customer_reviews.author: beth miller

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, but bottom let's water soak in
customer_reviews.text: We love the tent, the only thing that I don't like about it was the floor of the tent was pretty wet after a rain storm. We had a tarp under the tent but it still soaked through. Thankfully we had air mattress to sleep on, otherwise we would have been wet. Overall the tent is great it didn't leak any other place during a rain storm.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Spacious tent
customer_reviews.text: Great size tent! Can fit a queen size air mattress, a large dog crate, and two single size air mattresses.... with plenty of walking space and space for your bags. Unfortunately the zippers for both doors and windows gave us a hard time. This was from our second use out at the cost. The winds were not aggressive at all, it was perfect beach weather on the northern coast. Hoping to come into contact with customer service about getting a replacement due to it's faulty zippers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chatreau

customer_reviews.title: great amount of room
customer_reviews.text: So my wife and I camp a lot and we often do long camping road trips. We rely on our tents to be our only source of shelter and we never really know what to expect weather wise! This has now completed 2 long road trips with us and I have been very impressed. great amount of room; the ceiling height and separate rooms are a big bonus. For such a big tent it doesn't weigh that much and packs down to a reasonable size. It is very sturdy and withstood some pretty rough weather without any issues. Honestly its just the 2 of us but you could easily fit a family of 5-6 in here no problems.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent, easier to set up than expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews I got scared this would be difficult to set up compared to our old dome tent. It is a breeze! It sets up just like a dome tent except that the dome comprises the roof, then you just set up the 6straight legs to raise the dome. I'm 6ft and can stand easily which is great for changing. Tip, if you're driving 9 hours to complete at Custer state park, just pay an extra $25 and rent a rustic cabin in the campgrounds... Then you don't have to worry about packing up a wet tent every day, though it did hold up to water nicely without additional coating like some have suggested.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I have use this on two trips. Both trips had heavy rain. I did get a little bit of water in through the corner of the windows. Not much. The rain fly was flawless. This tent is huge. It's footprint just about covers a 10x20 tarp. It is a summer tent. It is very well ventilated in the ceiling. You can close the windows and still get a lot of air. The only negative is the steel poles come apart. They are linked together. I solves that problem by welding pin inside so that it cannot happen again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This tent started out great. Easy to put up and nice and roomy. Paid the higher price because of the sturdiness reviews compared to other tents. After the 1st night camping out, there was condensation around the whole perimeter of the bottom of the tent. It did not rain but temperatures dropped to the low 30s during the night. Anything sitting on the floor next to the walls got wet although we used the Browning tarp as a floor cover under the tent. To top it off, the long gray pole snapped while taking the tent down.
customer_reviews.author: ks1997

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tent
customer_reviews.text: Large, straight-walled tent that is ultra sturdy. I used it for the first time at deer camp and had wind gusts up to 50 mph come up while I was hunting. I expected to see a tent in shambles when I returned from the morning hunt but it had held up perfectly. I was tempted to spend half the money on a similar looking tent, but my wife told me not to cheap out and to go with the Browning. I'm sure glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We have tried this tent once and were very pleased. You can stand up in not just the middle and the 2 rooms are spacious. It rained the night we tried it and it seemed pretty waterproof. The quality of workmanship is better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Stock

customer_reviews.title: Great spacious tent!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to assemble. Definitely not a single person set up so make sure you have a buddy. Very spacious. We only had two issues. The rod that goes on top has a rubberband string to connect it and it snapped and broke. Need to reach out to vendor to replace that as it won’t work without that. We got hit with a rainstorm that lasted 40 minutes and the tent handled itself pretty well. But we did have water leak in from the windows but were able to throw down some paper towels to keep it controlled. Love the storage bags to easily transport and store the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Received our new tent in time for our annual trip, I was so excited. We went to set it up and the poles were broke. I contacted customer service to get replacement poles and was told it had to be a full replacement and they could ship it to me and I could return the defective product that's great except it wouldn't arrive until the Friday after we left? Really? So I need a tent and thought browning would be a good quality tent. I am really disappointed. I had to place another order to fix the poles that I am certainly not confident the rest will not break. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Browning Big Horn tent. Great tent so far!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't officially camped in it yet because it is still cold here. We did set it up in our living room. :) it's very big. Looks to be made with great quality. Looks like all the seams are well done and it's nice and tall. I am 5'4" and I cannot reach the center part of the top which is great for my husband who is 6' tall. Big enough to put three twin beds and then some! It's folded up nicely and even fit back in the carry bag. The poles seem sturdy. So far, we love it. I will update after we have used it outdoors. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used this tent yet but we set it up at home so we would know what it was like before we went camping. The last tent we got was one of those pop up type so I was concerned this was going to be challenging. It was very easy to et up and more room than our pop up type has.
customer_reviews.author: P. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. It's made with quality. The bag that it came with has plenty of space to store the tent when you're packing it in there. You know how sometimes you can't get the tent back in the bag once you take it out....they obviously thought about that because I don't ever have a problem. The tent is simple to put up, easy to take down. Light weight.
customer_reviews.author: jeff_prev

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: I put the tent up easily, plenty of room, did well in the rain with no leaks, but when it took it down, one of the corners that the poles slide into ripped away from the tent rendering it unless after only one use. ☹️ Other than this slight defect the tent was great. I'm going to call their customer service office and see how they can help. Update the customer service representatives were very polite and helpful they shipped me a new tent immediately!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh&Lila Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and outstanding service
customer_reviews.text: My first use of this tent was a week at the Jersey Shore. The tent withstood two severe thunderstorms each with 90+ mph wind gusts, no problem. On my fifth camping trip, both flex poles cracked. The tent stayed up. The damage to the poles was not evident until I took the tent down. I contacted Browning / Alps. The rep gave me an e-mail address and specified the information needed. I provided the information and photos of the damaged poles. Within a half hour I received a reply that replacement poles would be sent. I received new poles within a couple of days. i am delighted with the tent and especially the service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything as Described - Even Better Than Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: First use: Several days at the lake Unpacked and sat up alone in just under 25 mins - first time Took down and packed alone in 20 mins - first time Extreme weather condensation outside and under - interior stayed completely dry Great quality parts and materials Just over 34 lbs as advertised I have owned and used a great many tent brands and sizes throughout the years - I highly recommend this one so far for multiple people. Love the high lower borders at the doors to keep debris out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Quality large tent, equal to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: The tent is big. The divider is hard to reach the top if short, and you lose the pockets when you roll back the flaps. The zipper can get stuck, but so did our last tent and I think that's common on many with the angle of the door frame easy to set up and seems very sturdy, l she durable.YouTube has some nice videos about this tent and the setup and the issues that might arise.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Great size. Easy to assemble and take down.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down a great tent. EASY to put together and take down ( which is a huge plus if you are an avid camper). Large enough for my family of 5. Can fit two queen mattress's , two tables and some gear. Stop looking and just buy this tent.
customer_reviews.author: MikefromLI

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!  Good design, fantastic fly top, kinda of rubberized, kept us dry through 2 rain storms!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent!!! Huge! Easy to put up, even for first time it took maybe 20 min tops. Very good quality roof and zippers. Only one downside to this tent or it would have received 5 stars. It's floor is all the same material as the walls! All my other tents have had from 4" to 6" inches from the bottom a different material that would be a bit thicker and more like a tarp. So make sure you bring a tarp big enough and also dig your trench around your tent if your expecting rain!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tent with plenty of room. No longer have an aching back due to bending over. More than enough comfort/space for Family of 5 with cots and gear. You will need at least 2 people for setup, but once you figure the layout of the tent it’s pretty simple to assemble. Great family tent!
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: A great family tent to grow into!
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from our first camping trip in this tent. We fit a queen air mattress, pack and play, and three kids in sleeping bags very comfortably with plenty of room to walk around and stash our stuff.My 6'2" husband was able to comfortably walk around the entire tent. It rained lightly one night, the tent was bone dry. Set up took two people about 10 minutes, plus another 5 for the rainfly. Overall, we are VERY happy with our choice and are looking forward to using this tent for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie H.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room but leaks
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love how easy the set up was, how tall it is and how much extra room we had in this tent. We ordered it for a Memorial day camping trip and it was delivered just in time. The first night it rained and we had water come in on all the window seams. Not a terrible amount but if we hadn't been on air beds we would have been wet. I excessively sprayed the tent and seams with waterproofing spray and it helped a lot but we still continue to get some water in when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Stammer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable camping with Browning Camping Big Horn Family Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is large and stands tall. You can zip up the partition and build two separate areas inside. It fits 2 queen size air mattresses side by side with a lot of room left for a seating area. It is super easy to set up, the rain fly works perfectly and the customer service is the best. While doing a practice set up of this tent in our backyard we accidentally ripped one of the loops, so we contacted Browning Camping and they mailed a new one immediately, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Colin & Adriane Lee-Wo

customer_reviews.title: Nice large tall base camp tent.
customer_reviews.text: Large tent with a large footprint. This is a car camping or base camping tent. The 2 entrances and center divider give a family or group some privacy. Both sides are large enough to accommodate a large mattress or a couple cots plus gear. The straight tall sides allow free movement within the tent and the windows allow nice ventilation. Easy set up in about 15 minutes, can be done with 1 but 2-3 is easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Kvasnicka

customer_reviews.title: if only the right poles were included!
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a 4 star review if the tent actually came with the right poles. But one of the 6 main poles had an extra segment. I’m not sure how that passed inspection. Fortunately were doing a dry run in the back yard and had tools to be able to remove the extra section and reattach the elastic within. This would have been more challenging in the woods. Otherwise the tent went up easily and provided lots of room. The zippers catch easily on the rain flap if you aren’t careful (the kids kept doing this).
customer_reviews.author: SuperGeek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Easy to set.  Summer tent
customer_reviews.text: Everything was perfect. The only thing I didn’t like was the top be completely screened and no way to zip up or cut off wind at night when it gets chilly. Perfect summer tent and the inside height is nice
customer_reviews.author: EJSUSAN02

customer_reviews.title: ITS GIGANTIC!! Perfect for the whole family cozy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason when I bought this I thought it was an instant setup tent. That's not the case here and I was a bit dissatisfied. Other than that I followed the instructions and had it up in about 5 to 10 min. HUGE TENT!
customer_reviews.author: AJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Will be taking it out for our first trip this ...
customer_reviews.text: Will be taking it out for our first trip this weekend. When we did a test run in our yard, it was a breeze to set up and take down. The poles are color coordinated so you know exactly which hole to slide it in to. And it is SO big and roomy on the inside. We are a family of four, plus a large 80 lb dog, and there is plenty of room. Not sure how cold it will be for us, since it's just a rain fly that goes over the top, but I will update after we get back from our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Tankagal

customer_reviews.title: Massive, well built
customer_reviews.text: Tent is great! Love the high-angle walls, the whole space is usable, extremely tall (I'm 6'3" and can stand with room to spare in pretty much the whole tent. Only issue is the weight... they didn't use anything that would qualify as lightweight in construction of this... its a large bag, and heavy at that.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for car camping. Plenty of space for our family of 4. No leaks after a few days of rain without applying seam sealer. More internal pockets would be great but I won't tick off a star for this.
customer_reviews.author: keops

customer_reviews.title: Water comes in through bottom in totally dry conditions
customer_reviews.text: We set the tent up over night simply to see how it looked before we actually needed it. We had completely zero precipitation and very low humidity. But, there was water pooled in all 4 corners the next morning. I sopped it up and left it set up another day. Same conditions. Same thing- water pooled in all 4 corners. It appears the material for the sides of the tent is exactly the same as the floor. (By the way, I DID set it up on a tarp). I think the floor material needs to be a different material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Family Tent Fun
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love our new tent!!!!! My husband is 6’4” and finally can enjoy camping in a tent he actually fits in!!!! We had one pole damaged and they sent us a complete set of poles for this tent! Love this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lea

customer_reviews.title: Good tent but make sure you steak it down good ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tent but make sure you steak it down good because the wind will blow it away. This is a concern for me since we haven't taken it camping yet and have just set it up in the back yard. VERY big inside and it's nice to stand up in. Will update after we go camping with it and really use it!
customer_reviews.author: DJMason

customer_reviews.title: Poles break in medium wind.
customer_reviews.text: Took camping once. The wind picked up and broke 3 poles. Tent was staked properly. Called browning and all they said was where to buy replacement parts. Bad customer service from browning.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: What a Tent!!
customer_reviews.text: A great tent. Great quality. Terrific headroom. A lot of space inside and easy to put together. Just get familiar with the instructions before you try to put it up. I especially love the doors. They are easy to open and close and the tent is easy to go in and out of. I'm looking forward to my next camping trip to use this tent.
customer_reviews.author: B.J. Hooker

customer_reviews.title: They keep making them thinner and thinner
customer_reviews.text: They keep making them thinner and thinner. Tent came with 2 holes in it. The fabric just seems very thin and easy to puncture. For something designed for the outdoors this tent sure isn't going to last very long with moderate use. The only that's great about this tent is the sturdiness in wind and the size.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kulakowski

customer_reviews.title: It’s decent but kinda on the cheap side.
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent, pretty easy to setup (can do it with one person) I wish the floor was thicker and the rain fly had an awning or was bigger. Did not have any leaking issues. Seems like it’s on the cheap side though and probably won’t last a real long time.
customer_reviews.author: FaroRod

customer_reviews.title: Held up pretty well in the rain and wind
customer_reviews.text: Held up pretty well in the rain and wind... But it did end up tearing where the pole connects to the bottom in a storm while we were at the Outer Banks. The tent is very spacious and just what we were looking for. Hopefully I can just repair the piece that tore!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny D.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy , but spacious
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY ! Definitely need two people to put together . However it is very large and spacious . Fits two queen size mattresses and still have lots of room to spare . Don’t expect it to block out any light or anything .
customer_reviews.author: corcor_harris

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be scared of storms.
customer_reviews.text: We camped in Rocky Mountain National Park in the Glacier Basin Campground. We had some storms come through. It withstood rain, a touch of hail, and wind gusts that I’m sure were 40mph or greater. Perfectly dry inside, and it stayed upright when I had my doubts. There was one part that broke which was the one of the flat straps (out of 6) that was staked into the ground on the windward side. Very impressive tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent.
customer_reviews.text: This a great tent. It took 10 minutes to set-up and I did it all by myself. It rained 3 inches on us over the space of 3 hours and not a drop of water came into the tent . I was very please with it. I always camp with a trap under my tent as well so that helped as well. It is a pretty big tent to you need to make sure that you have plenty of room for the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent, have not had in the rain yet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent, have not had in the rain yet. Little tough putting up the first time. Have never owned a nice tent like this. Read the directions before you start if your a novice to good quality tents.
customer_reviews.author: Brucedusty

customer_reviews.title: A well made tent
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for the first time last week. Had a whole day of rain and not a bit of leakage. Recommend you put a good tarp underneath (as you should with all tents) to protect the floor. The fabric is a good weight. this tent is very spacious and good headroom. The extra coverage over the doors helps keep the weather out when you open the doors.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great customer service. Completely waterproof too.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review; This tent is everything I was looking for! Plenty of head room, easy to set up and put away. After a week straight of rain it still did not leak. It's the best quality tent I've seen. Plus the original tent body had a hole and they quickly sent me a new one before my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Bark

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Very big and roomy tent. And the quality is evident in the details. It come with a curtain divider which is great for privacy. I love the fact it has two doors and big windows which is great for the summertime. For anyone who wants a quality tent with plenty of room, this is the tent for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great in the rain and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent performed well in torrential rain. I was surprised by how dry it was with pouring rain all night long. The only part that caused water was not having the window zippers closed at the top of the window. If you have the zippers all the way down to the side rain will get in between the gap in the 2 zippers. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jmeehan

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Great company!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tent in August 2016. Used it once in great weather with no problem. In June, 2017, used it for only the second time during a very rainy weekend and it leaked. I took photos of the water inside the tent and sent them to the manufacturer. They were quick to respond, and it a short time, I had a new tent! I just used the new replacement tent this past weekend. It was tested...hard rain, but no leaks! I love the tent, and service after the sale. It's refreshing to work with a company that stands behind their product. I've owned other tents, but I recommend this tent to anyone who asks!
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for sure. Had 2 holes in floor of it upon unpacking it to use for first time. Took a few pictures of it called browning and without any hesitation they sent a brand new tent body to my home within 4 business days. If your looking to buy a tent I'd look no further than this Big Horn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade we could hope for!
customer_reviews.text: This tent has been AMAZING as our new mansion! Setup gets faster and easier with each outing. We do use a tarp underneath, as you ALWAYS should to protect the floor. Our queen, double- height air mattress easily fits on one side, with plenty of stand-up room all round. There's a great breeze w the windows open. This was a fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bethanystar

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried 3 different tents and sent them all back. This one by far is so amazing! Roomy, comfy and doesn't leak!! It went through the monsoons 3 days in a row and dry!! I love this tent. Enough room for extra large cots, a chair for each one, carpet for cozy feeling and if the weather made you stay in, well, very nice!!
customer_reviews.author: Sussi B Saber

customer_reviews.title: This tent works great. I used it on my last hunting trip
customer_reviews.text: This tent works great. I used it on my last hunting trip. I slept in it 5 day with no problems. It got windy a couple of days, like 15 to 20 mph wind gust but it took like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Tough as can be. Held up to strong winds and has huge interior room. Easy to set up with two people and the carry back is oversized to make it easy to pack back up. Customer service from Alps Mountaineering has been top notch
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to assemble, but it takes two people, especially if you're in a windy location. The tent did a great job keeping the wind out. The relatively vertical walls really do make a huge difference in usable space. I love that there are three pockets for storage in each room and that each room has it's own door.
customer_reviews.author: BOGIE ROSYPAL

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it’s a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: So far very impressed with this tent. We researched big and affordable tents quite a bit before making our purchase. This is very roomy and pretty easy to set up. Camped in the rain and the tent stayed dry. Zippers work well. Star gazing in this tent is the best! No complaints. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for family or four.
customer_reviews.text: Browning tent went up without any issues. We liked the roominess and ceilings height, it’s a good size for family of four. We were able to use XL cots. The tent also stayed dry during two nights of rain. Only issue was one of the door zippers would get stuck if you weren’t careful.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A Poulin

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My sister is homeless. After the storm her tent was destroyed. I went shopping for a tent to replace the old one. Reading reviews I settled on this one. With in two weeks of it being set up there was a big wind storm. 20 MPH winds. She texted me and said her tent was still standing and no damage. While others in the camp were w/o shelter. I highly recommend this tent to any one who needs shelter for an extended amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Damama

customer_reviews.title: It's BIG!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality tent with some very nice design features. Just be sure you really want something this big. I ended up giving mine to my son and buying one half the size. You can EASILY put four full-sized cots in here with plenty of room in between for a card table and chairs! I was able to put it up by myself but two people would definitely be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A

customer_reviews.title: Its a tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift dont know much else about it, have had no complaints or praises about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent broke on the first camping trip but it was very much still usable. I called Browning which replaced it without any objections. Browning is a great company that backs their products.
customer_reviews.author: mrs99mrs99

customer_reviews.title: but great tent overall
customer_reviews.text: Hit with a rain storm with strong winds on our first outing with it. No water inside at all! As others have said, the way the divider pulls back incompletely (and makes the storage pockets hard to get to) is a small short-coming, but great tent overall.
customer_reviews.author: D. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftmanship
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent twice. On the second time - the zipper on the main entrance completely blew up. Now - we are stuck with a tent with a door that won't close.
customer_reviews.author: Brian RING

customer_reviews.title: Tent is great, withstands rain but not the winds
customer_reviews.text: Tent is great, withstands rain but not the winds. Brand new tent, used it once in the back yard (beautiful night - August 2015) for all the cousins, it was perfect. Planned to use it at a family reunion camping on Oahu in October 2015 when my son asked if they could use it at a football retreat on football field. Light to moderate winds with rain constantly pounded the tent and the poles snapped. So much for our family reunion camping. Never slept in the tent yet. Just like the other posting 2 months ago, need stronger poles.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara JL Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in about 15 minutes, large, roomy and will be used for hunting. My husband loves it. However while it looks great in the back yard, it has yet to be used. This fall when hunting season is again upon us we will test it out in the weather of the Cascade mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Gardening Gal

customer_reviews.title: great tent went through some heavy storms but was dry ...
customer_reviews.text: great tent went through some heavy storms but was dry I did put a tarp over top and had water proofed it. everybody in camp ground through I crazy when I put the tarp on top before big storm blew in because I knew there would be strong winds but they where the ones running for cars to sleep while we watched tv. great product.
customer_reviews.author: scott e rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tent! Great quality! I like the room divider with pockets and that there are two doors. My husband can actually stand up straight inside the tent too. The mesh for the windows is well done too.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Rich

customer_reviews.title: Want some quality in your tent ??
customer_reviews.text: A real quality tent. Well made and easy to set-up. Take reasonable care of this tent and it will last your kids growing up.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bruce Gietzen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent is great we have only used it one time and we had a good amount of rain fall we stayed nice and dry. The only problem I have is with the rods that go over the door the end on each rod has broken about 1" up from each end not sure way?? and also had to cut the door window zipper tie out of the stitching for the door zipper
customer_reviews.author: Fair and Honest Review

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! The first night we used it it stormed so bad it felt like it was raining sideways. The couple that we went camping with had water throughout their entire tent while our tent stayed perfectly dry! Very easy to put up and take down, and to get back in the bag! The rain tarp is also easy to put on and the cords make it easy to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Luna

customer_reviews.title: Good tent. Decent quality. Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent. We love the side. The little flap keeps getting caught in the zipper. That's so annoying. And the bottling lining of the tent tore upon first use but it's nothing a little duct tape can't fix. I will just insure to pack a roll on out next trip. It's decently easy to put up and take down once you figure out the instructions, which are way, super vague. I would buy this tent again. Its perfect for our growing family.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Philips

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love this tent
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this tent. Very easy setup and so roomy inside. We bought two oversized camp cots and still have space for storage tubs and all the other gear we seem to pack with us. Love the cabin style as my 6'2" husband can walk around without having to bend over. Needed to contact Alps and can only applaud their team!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia D.

customer_reviews.title: Great wind and rain resistance.
customer_reviews.text: Researched for months and decided upon this one. Fast shipping, arrived fast in great packaging. If you want great quality and room, this tent is for you. Left it up from July-late Oct with fly cover, wind and rain did not bother it at all. Love this tent!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: It had a bad leak around a defective seam
customer_reviews.text: Bought one. It had a bad leak around a defective seam. Returned it only to get another one with a slight leak around one of the zippered windows. Paid too much for the quality of this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Geneva C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent so far on multiple camping trips with ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent so far on multiple camping trips with a queen air mattress with 2 adults, a twin air mattress for a 6yo and a pack n play for an infant/toddler. Very easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Pray there’s no wind
customer_reviews.text: This tent has a ton of space, is pretty easy to set up and take down. The only issue (and its a big one) is if there is any more than a 10 mph wind, be prepared for the sides to cave in on you. It also lets in the breeze even with the fly. If the forecast mentions more than a light breeze, I leave this baby home.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it's a beautiful tent, well made
customer_reviews.text: I had read one review that said it wouldn't leak from dew so I used my new tent this past weekend without the rain fly. The first night was Ok but the second I had quite a bit of leakage. So in South Louisiana I'd advise using the rainfly even with no chance of rain. Other than that it's a beautiful tent, well made, easy to put up, and pack away!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Langdon

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good name= good tent
customer_reviews.text: I like four things best: 1) the Browning limited lifetime warranty 2) waterproof tent 3) two tent doors and 4) the vertical side walls. What I liked the least was not having an awning over the doors to keep water away when you enter the tent. Another thing, but not that important, was not being able to remove the center dividing curtain (can you? I may have missed that part.)
customer_reviews.author: jim gacey

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Endured a serious rain storm okay
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Endured a serious rain storm okay. A bit of a challenge putting up on a windy day, but I expect most tents would have presented the same challenge. Very little stress on zippers which is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kulik
